intro: Diodia pulchella, commonly known as the pretty diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Diodia pulchella thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
